Intro
-----


Integration Studio allows you to build your data pipeline from start to finish, all in Magic ETL. With Integration StudioÂ you can configure a Connector, build your pipeline, and then configure your Writeback Connector all from the Magic ETL canvas.


**Note:** Integration Studio is enabled after you purchase a Writeback Connector. For a list of available Writeback Connectors, seeÂ [Writeback Connectors](..\..\category\writeback_connectors\index.html "Writeback Connectors").
Using Integration Studio
------------------------


1. Drag the **Input DataSet**Â tile onto the Magic ETL Canvas.


![1.png](1.png)


2. ChooseÂ **Select DataSetÂ**and then either choose a pre-existing DataSet or **Create New**Â to configure a new Connector.


![2.png](2.png)


3. Search for the Connector you want in the Search Connectors Box.


![3.png](3.png)


4. Configure each step of the Connector Wizard and select **Save**Â to finish. Your DataSet will build and the columns will appear in the **Configuration** section.


![4.png](4.png)


5. Add more tiles to cleanse and manipulate your data if desired.


6. Drag the **Writeback** tile onto the Canvas found in the **DataSets** section of Magic ETL.Â 


7. Name the output DataSet and add an optional description. Then, select **Configure Writeback**.


![5.png](5.png)


8. Select the Writeback Connector you would like to use.


![6.png](6.png)


9. Set up the Connector configurationÂ (you will need a Client ID and Secret from [https://developer.domo.com](https://developer.domo.com "https://developer.domo.com").)


![7.png](7.png)


10. Choose, **O****n dataset update**Â to update the Writeback DataSet whenever the DataFlow runs, or set a schedule to run at specified times.


![8.png](8.png)


11. Choose **Save and Run** to run your DataFlow and the Writeback Connector.  
  
![9.png](9.png)


Your Writeback Connector is now properly configured and you can continue to build your Magic ETLÂ DataFlow.
